banner.backgrounds.overlayColor.title: Background Overlay Color

banner.backgrounds.useOverlay.title: Background Overlay
banner.backgrounds.useOverlay.description:
Apply an overlay color of the background for improved contrast.
This color is detected automatically, but can be overridden with the
banner.backgrounds.overlayColor variable.
banner.backgrounds.useOverlay.markdownDescription:
Apply an overlay color of the background for improved contrast.

banner.description.font.align.markdownDescription: Describes how text contents are horizontally aligned if the contents do not completely fill their container.

banner.description.font.lineHeight.title: Line Height

banner.description.font.shadow.title: Text Shadow
banner.description.font.shadow.description: Enables shadow effects to be applied to the text of the element. Allows any formats of [the CSS 'text-shadow' property.](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/text-shadow)

banner.description.font.size.title: Size
banner.description.font.size.description: Indicates the desired height of glyphs in the applied font. Numerical units will be applied as pixels, for example '12' will be interpreted as '12px'.
banner.description.font.size.markdownDescription: Indicates the desired height of glyphs in the applied font. Numerical units will be applied as pixels, for example '12' will be interpreted as '12px'.

banner.description.font.textDecoration.markdownDescription: Apply some decoration to the text.

banner.description.font.transform.title: Transform
banner.description.font.transform.description: Specifies how to capitalize an element's text. It can be used to make text appear in all-uppercase or all-lowercase, or with each word capitalized.

banner.outerBackground.breakpoints.mobil.title: image
banner.outerBackground.breakpoints.mobil.description:
Set a background image or linear-gradient for the component.Note: Some special parsing may occur on this value.
- URL's beginning with a "~" character will be relative to the current theme directory. For example if the current file-based them is in /addons/themes/my-theme, ~/design/my-image.png would be equivalent to /addons/themes/my-theme/design/my-image.png
- Please pass _URLs_ for this variable. __Do not__ pass urls wrapped in "url()".

callToAction.description.font.lineHeight.markdownDescription: Sets the distance between lines of text.

callToAction.description.font.shadow.title: Text Shadow
callToAction.description.font.shadow.description: Enables shadow effects to be applied to the text of the element. Allows any formats of [the CSS 'text-shadow' property.](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/text-shadow)
callToAction.description.font.shadow.markdownDescription: Enables shadow effects to be applied to the text of the element. Allows any formats of [the CSS 'text-shadow' property.](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/text-shadow)

callToAction.description.font.size.title: Size
callToAction.description.font.size.description: Indicates the desired height of glyphs in the applied font. Numerical units will be applied as pixels, for example '12' will be interpreted as '12px'.
callToAction.description.font.size.markdownDescription: Indicates the desired height of glyphs in the applied font. Numerical units will be applied as pixels, for example '12' will be interpreted as '12px'.

callToAction.description.font.textDecora.title: Text Decoration
callToAction.description.font.textDecora.description: Apply some decoration to the text.
callToAction.description.font.textDecora.markdownDescription: Apply some decoration to the text.

callToAction.description.font.transform.title: Transform
callToAction.description.font.transform.description: Specifies how to capitalize an element's text. It can be used to make text appear in all-uppercase or all-lowercase, or with each word capitalized.
callToAction.description.font.transform.markdownDescription: Specifies how to capitalize an element's text. It can be used to make text appear in all-uppercase or all-lowercase, or with each word capitalized.

callToAction.description.font.weight.title: Weight
callToAction.description.font.weight.description: Specifies weight/boldness of glyphs in the applied font.
callToAction.description.font.weight.markdownDescription: Specifies weight/boldness of glyphs in the applied font.

callToAction.description.spacing.all.title: All
callToAction.description.spacing.all.description: Set the spacing for all sides of the component. Equivalent to setting the top, bottom, left, and right. Numeric units will be interpreted as pixels.
callToAction.description.spacing.all.markdownDescription: Set the spacing for all sides of the component. Equivalent to setting the top, bottom, left, and right. Numeric units will be interpreted as pixels.

callToAction.description.spacing.bottom.title: Bottom
callToAction.description.spacing.bottom.description: Set the bottom spacing of the component. Numeric units will be interpreted as pixels.
callToAction.description.spacing.bottom.markdownDescription: Set the bottom spacing of the component. Numeric units will be interpreted as pixels.

callToAction.description.spacing.horizon.title: Horizontal
callToAction.description.spacing.horizon.description: Set the horizontal spacing of the component. Equivalent to setting the left & right. Numeric units will be interpreted as pixels.
callToAction.description.spacing.horizon.markdownDescription: Set the horizontal spacing of the component. Equivalent to setting the left & right. Numeric units will be interpreted as pixels.

callToAction.description.spacing.left.title: Left
callToAction.description.spacing.left.description: Set the left spacing of the component. Numeric units will be interpreted as pixels.
callToAction.description.spacing.left.markdownDescription: Set the left spacing of the component. Numeric units will be interpreted as pixels.

callToAction.description.spacing.right.title: Right

callToAction.description.spacing.top.title: Top

callToAction.description.spacing.vertica.title: Vertical

callToAction.image.ratio.title: Aspect Ratio
callToAction.image.ratio.description: Aspect ratio of the call to action image.
callToAction.image.ratio.markdownDescription: Aspect ratio of the call to action image.

callToAction.options.box.background.atta.title: attachment
callToAction.options.box.background.atta.description: Set the background attachment of the component. [MDN Reference](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/background-attachment)
callToAction.options.box.background.atta.markdownDescription: Set the background attachment of the component. [MDN Reference](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/background-attachment)

callToAction.options.box.background.colo.title: color
callToAction.options.box.background.colo.description: Set the background color of the component.
callToAction.options.box.background.colo.markdownDescription: Set the background color of the component.

callToAction.options.box.background.imag.title: image
callToAction.options.box.background.imag.description:
Set a background image or linear-gradient for the component.Note: Some special parsing may occur on this value.
- URL's beginning with a "~" character will be relative to the current theme directory. For example if the current file-based them is in /addons/themes/my-theme, ~/design/my-image.png would be equivalent to /addons/themes/my-theme/design/my-image.png
- Please pass _URLs_ for this variable. __Do not__ pass urls wrapped in "url()".

Set a background image or linear-gradient for the component.Note: Some special parsing may occur on this value.
- URL's beginning with a "~" character will be relative to the current theme directory. For example if the current file-based them is in /addons/themes/my-theme, ~/design/my-image.png would be equivalent to /addons/themes/my-theme/design/my-image.png
- Please pass _URLs_ for this variable. __Do not__ pass urls wrapped in "url()".

callToAction.options.box.background.posi.title: position

callToAction.options.box.background.posi.markdownDescription: Set the background position of the component. [MDN Reference](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/background-position)

callToAction.options.box.background.size.title: size

callToAction.options.box.background.size.markdownDescription: Set the background size of the component. [MDN Reference](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/background-size)

callToAction.options.box.background.unse.title: Ignore Default Background
callToAction.options.box.background.unse.description: Some components have a built-in background. In these scenarios setting this variable to true will remove the default background, even if other background properties are not specified.
callToAction.options.box.background.unse.markdownDescription: Some components have a built-in background. In these scenarios setting this variable to true will remove the default background, even if other background properties are not specified.

callToAction.options.box.borderType.title: Border Type
callToAction.options.box.borderType.description:
Choose one of a few border types.

- none: Apply no styling on the box.
- border: Apply a standard border around the item. Automatically applies spacing as well. See the `global.border` variables to change this border.
- shadow: Apply a standard "widget" box shadow. Automatically applies spacing as well. See the `shadow.widget` variables to change this shadow.
- separator: Apply top and bottom separators to the item. Automatically applies vertical spacing.
callToAction.options.box.borderType.markdownDescription:
Choose one of a few border types.

- none: Apply no styling on the box.
- border: Apply a standard border around the item. Automatically applies spacing as well. See the `global.border` variables to change this border.
- shadow: Apply a standard "widget" box shadow. Automatically applies spacing as well. See the `shadow.widget` variables to change this shadow.
- separator: Apply top and bottom separators to the item. Automatically applies vertical spacing.

categoryList.contentBoxes.depth3.backgro.title: attachment

categoryList.contentBoxes.depth3.backgro.title: color
categoryList.contentBoxes.depth3.backgro.description: Set the background color of the component.
categoryList.contentBoxes.depth3.backgro.markdownDescription: Set the background color of the component.

categoryList.contentBoxes.depth3.backgro.title: image
categoryList.contentBoxes.depth3.backgro.description:
Set a background image or linear-gradient for the component.Note: Some special parsing may occur on this value.
- URL's beginning with a "~" character will be relative to the current theme directory. For example if the current file-based them is in /addons/themes/my-theme, ~/design/my-image.png would be equivalent to /addons/themes/my-theme/design/my-image.png
- Please pass _URLs_ for this variable. __Do not__ pass urls wrapped in "url()".

categoryList.contentBoxes.depth3.backgro.title: Ignore Default Background
categoryList.contentBoxes.depth3.backgro.description: Some components have a built-in background. In these scenarios setting this variable to true will remove the default background, even if other background properties are not specified.
categoryList.contentBoxes.depth3.backgro.markdownDescription: Some components have a built-in background. In these scenarios setting this variable to true will remove the default background, even if other background properties are not specified.

categoryList.contentBoxes.depth3.borderT.title: Border Type
categoryList.contentBoxes.depth3.borderT.description:
Choose one of a few border types.

- none: Apply no styling on the box.
- border: Apply a standard border around the item. Automatically applies spacing as well. See the `global.border` variables to change this border.
- shadow: Apply a standard "widget" box shadow. Automatically applies spacing as well. See the `shadow.widget` variables to change this shadow.
- separator: Apply top and bottom separators to the item. Automatically applies vertical spacing.

conversationList.contentBoxes.depth1.bac.title: image
conversationList.contentBoxes.depth1.bac.description:
Set a background image or linear-gradient for the component.Note: Some special parsing may occur on this value.
- URL's beginning with a "~" character will be relative to the current theme directory. For example if the current file-based them is in /addons/themes/my-theme, ~/design/my-image.png would be equivalent to /addons/themes/my-theme/design/my-image.png
- Please pass _URLs_ for this variable. __Do not__ pass urls wrapped in "url()".

conversationList.contentBoxes.depth1.bor.title: Border Type
conversationList.contentBoxes.depth1.bor.description:
Choose one of a few border types.

- none: Apply no styling on the box.
- border: Apply a standard border around the item. Automatically applies spacing as well. See the `global.border` variables to change this border.
- shadow: Apply a standard "widget" box shadow. Automatically applies spacing as well. See the `shadow.widget` variables to change this shadow.
- separator: Apply top and bottom separators to the item. Automatically applies vertical spacing.

discussion.contentBoxes.depth2.backgroun.title: image
discussion.contentBoxes.depth2.backgroun.description:
Set a background image or linear-gradient for the component.Note: Some special parsing may occur on this value.
- URL's beginning with a "~" character will be relative to the current theme directory. For example if the current file-based them is in /addons/themes/my-theme, ~/design/my-image.png would be equivalent to /addons/themes/my-theme/design/my-image.png
- Please pass _URLs_ for this variable. __Do not__ pass urls wrapped in "url()".

discussion.contentBoxes.depth2.borderTyp.title: Border Type
discussion.contentBoxes.depth2.borderTyp.description:
Choose one of a few border types.

- none: Apply no styling on the box.
- border: Apply a standard border around the item. Automatically applies spacing as well. See the `global.border` variables to change this border.
- shadow: Apply a standard "widget" box shadow. Automatically applies spacing as well. See the `shadow.widget` variables to change this shadow.
- separator: Apply top and bottom separators to the item. Automatically applies vertical spacing.

Choose one of a few border types.

- border: Apply a standard border around the item. Automatically applies spacing as well. See the `global.border` variables to change this border.

- separator: Apply top and bottom separators to the item. Automatically applies vertical spacing.

global.contentBoxes.depth3.background.im.title: image
global.contentBoxes.depth3.background.im.description:
Set a background image or linear-gradient for the component.Note: Some special parsing may occur on this value.
- URL's beginning with a "~" character will be relative to the current theme directory. For example if the current file-based them is in /addons/themes/my-theme, ~/design/my-image.png would be equivalent to /addons/themes/my-theme/design/my-image.png
- Please pass _URLs_ for this variable. __Do not__ pass urls wrapped in "url()".

global.contentBoxes.depth3.borderType.title: Border Type
global.contentBoxes.depth3.borderType.description:
Choose one of a few border types.

- none: Apply no styling on the box.
- border: Apply a standard border around the item. Automatically applies spacing as well. See the `global.border` variables to change this border.
- shadow: Apply a standard "widget" box shadow. Automatically applies spacing as well. See the `shadow.widget` variables to change this shadow.
- separator: Apply top and bottom separators to the item. Automatically applies vertical spacing.

global.links.colors.keyboardFocus.title: Focus Color (Keyboard)

This can often be used to provide a very obvious focus color for users navigating with a keyboard, and a more subtle one for users with a pointing device. Hexidecimal colors preferred (Either #RRGGBB or #RRGGBBAA)

global.panelBoxes.depth3.background.imag.title: image
global.panelBoxes.depth3.background.imag.description:
Set a background image or linear-gradient for the component.Note: Some special parsing may occur on this value.
- URL's beginning with a "~" character will be relative to the current theme directory. For example if the current file-based them is in /addons/themes/my-theme, ~/design/my-image.png would be equivalent to /addons/themes/my-theme/design/my-image.png
- Please pass _URLs_ for this variable. __Do not__ pass urls wrapped in "url()".

global.panelBoxes.depth3.borderType.title: Border Type
global.panelBoxes.depth3.borderType.description:
Choose one of a few border types.

- none: Apply no styling on the box.
- border: Apply a standard border around the item. Automatically applies spacing as well. See the `global.border` variables to change this border.
- shadow: Apply a standard "widget" box shadow. Automatically applies spacing as well. See the `shadow.widget` variables to change this shadow.
- separator: Apply top and bottom separators to the item. Automatically applies vertical spacing.
global.panelBoxes.depth3.borderType.markdownDescription:
Choose one of a few border types.

- none: Apply no styling on the box.
- border: Apply a standard border around the item. Automatically applies spacing as well. See the `global.border` variables to change this border.
- shadow: Apply a standard "widget" box shadow. Automatically applies spacing as well. See the `shadow.widget` variables to change this shadow.
- separator: Apply top and bottom separators to the item. Automatically applies vertical spacing.

global.panelBoxes.depth3.itemSpacing.title: Depth 3 - Item Spacing
global.panelBoxes.depth3.itemSpacing.description: For certain border types, there is space between in items. This is that space in pixels.
global.panelBoxes.depth3.itemSpacing.markdownDescription: For certain border types, there is space between in items. This is that space in pixels.

global.panelBoxes.depth3.itemSpacingOnAl.title: Depth 3 - Apply Item Spacing on all items
global.panelBoxes.depth3.itemSpacingOnAl.description: Apply the item spacing even on the first and last items.
global.panelBoxes.depth3.itemSpacingOnAl.markdownDescription: Apply the item spacing even on the first and last items.

global.separator.size.markdownDescription: Sets color and size of separator

global.spacer.headingBox.title: Heading Box
global.spacer.headingBox.description: Controls spacing below heading boxes (a heading box includes a title, optional description, and optional subtitle). This will be used in addition to the `headingItem` spacing.
global.spacer.headingBox.markdownDescription: Controls spacing below heading boxes (a heading box includes a title, optional description, and optional subtitle). This will be used in addition to the `headingItem` spacing.

global.spacer.headingBoxCompact.title: Heading Box Compact
global.spacer.headingBoxCompact.description:
Controls inside small components with borders or shadows around them.
**This compact version is used on viewport sizes.**
global.spacer.headingBoxCompact.markdownDescription:
Controls inside small components with borders or shadows around them.
**This compact version is used on viewport sizes.**

global.spacer.mainLayout.title: Main Layout
global.spacer.mainLayout.description:
Controls spacing around main layouts like panel layouts.
When there are breadcrumbs this controls above the breadcrumbs.
global.spacer.mainLayout.markdownDescription:
Controls spacing around main layouts like panel layouts.
When there are breadcrumbs this controls above the breadcrumbs.

global.spacer.pageComponent.title: Page Component
global.spacer.pageComponent.description: Controls spacing around and inside of most top level site widgets placed in the top level of a page.
global.spacer.pageComponent.markdownDescription: Controls spacing around and inside of most top level site widgets placed in the top level of a page.

global.spacer.pageComponentCompact.title: Page Component Compact
global.spacer.pageComponentCompact.description:
Controls spacing around and inside of most widgets placed in the top level of a page **on mobile device sizes**.
Additionally this value is used for widgets placed inside of the main panel in panel layouts on all device sizes.
global.spacer.pageComponentCompact.markdownDescription:
Controls spacing around and inside of most widgets placed in the top level of a page **on mobile device sizes**.
Additionally this value is used for widgets placed inside of the main panel in panel layouts on all device sizes.

global.spacer.panelComponent.title: Panel Component
global.spacer.panelComponent.description: Controls spacing around and inside of most widgets placed inside of a secondary/side panel.
global.spacer.panelComponent.markdownDescription: Controls spacing around and inside of most widgets placed inside of a secondary/side panel.

homeWidgetItem.options.box.borderType.title: Border Type
homeWidgetItem.options.box.borderType.description:
Choose one of a few border types.

- none: Apply no styling on the box.
- border: Apply a standard border around the item. Automatically applies spacing as well. See the `global.border` variables to change this border.
- shadow: Apply a standard "widget" box shadow. Automatically applies spacing as well. See the `shadow.widget` variables to change this shadow.
- separator: Apply top and bottom separators to the item. Automatically applies vertical spacing.
homeWidgetItem.options.box.borderType.markdownDescription:
Choose one of a few border types.

- none: Apply no styling on the box.
- border: Apply a standard border around the item. Automatically applies spacing as well. See the `global.border` variables to change this border.
- shadow: Apply a standard "widget" box shadow. Automatically applies spacing as well. See the `shadow.widget` variables to change this shadow.
- separator: Apply top and bottom separators to the item. Automatically applies vertical spacing.

list.options.box.background.attachment.title: attachment

list.options.box.background.attachment.markdownDescription: Set the background attachment of the component. [MDN Reference](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/background-attachment)

list.options.box.background.color.markdownDescription: Set the background color of the component.

list.options.box.background.image.title: image
list.options.box.background.image.description:
Set a background image or linear-gradient for the component.Note: Some special parsing may occur on this value.
- URL's beginning with a "~" character will be relative to the current theme directory. For example if the current file-based them is in /addons/themes/my-theme, ~/design/my-image.png would be equivalent to /addons/themes/my-theme/design/my-image.png
- Please pass _URLs_ for this variable. __Do not__ pass urls wrapped in "url()".

list.options.box.background.unsetBackgro.title: Ignore Default Background
list.options.box.background.unsetBackgro.description: Some components have a built-in background. In these scenarios setting this variable to true will remove the default background, even if other background properties are not specified.
list.options.box.background.unsetBackgro.markdownDescription: Some components have a built-in background. In these scenarios setting this variable to true will remove the default background, even if other background properties are not specified.

list.options.box.borderType.title: Border Type
list.options.box.borderType.description:
Choose one of a few border types.

- none: Apply no styling on the box.
- border: Apply a standard border around the item. Automatically applies spacing as well. See the `global.border` variables to change this border.
- shadow: Apply a standard "widget" box shadow. Automatically applies spacing as well. See the `shadow.widget` variables to change this shadow.
- separator: Apply top and bottom separators to the item. Automatically applies vertical spacing.
list.options.box.borderType.markdownDescription:
Choose one of a few border types.

- none: Apply no styling on the box.
- border: Apply a standard border around the item. Automatically applies spacing as well. See the `global.border` variables to change this border.
- shadow: Apply a standard "widget" box shadow. Automatically applies spacing as well. See the `shadow.widget` variables to change this shadow.
- separator: Apply top and bottom separators to the item. Automatically applies vertical spacing.

numberedPager.background.image.title: image
numberedPager.background.image.description:
Set a background image or linear-gradient for the component.Note: Some special parsing may occur on this value.
- URL's beginning with a "~" character will be relative to the current theme directory. For example if the current file-based them is in /addons/themes/my-theme, ~/design/my-image.png would be equivalent to /addons/themes/my-theme/design/my-image.png
- Please pass _URLs_ for this variable. __Do not__ pass urls wrapped in "url()".

Set a background image or linear-gradient for the component.Note: Some special parsing may occur on this value.

profile.contentBoxes.depth1.background.s.markdownDescription: Set the background size of the component. [MDN Reference](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/background-size)

profile.contentBoxes.depth1.background.u.title: Ignore Default Background
profile.contentBoxes.depth1.background.u.description: Some components have a built-in background. In these scenarios setting this variable to true will remove the default background, even if other background properties are not specified.
profile.contentBoxes.depth1.background.u.markdownDescription: Some components have a built-in background. In these scenarios setting this variable to true will remove the default background, even if other background properties are not specified.

profile.contentBoxes.depth1.borderType.title: Border Type
profile.contentBoxes.depth1.borderType.description:
Choose one of a few border types.

- none: Apply no styling on the box.
- border: Apply a standard border around the item. Automatically applies spacing as well. See the `global.border` variables to change this border.
- shadow: Apply a standard "widget" box shadow. Automatically applies spacing as well. See the `shadow.widget` variables to change this shadow.
- separator: Apply top and bottom separators to the item. Automatically applies vertical spacing.

- shadow: Apply a standard "widget" box shadow. Automatically applies spacing as well. See the `shadow.widget` variables to change this shadow.
- separator: Apply top and bottom separators to the item. Automatically applies vertical spacing.

profile.contentBoxes.depth1.itemSpacing.title: Depth 1 - Item Spacing
profile.contentBoxes.depth1.itemSpacing.description: For certain border types, there is space between in items. This is that space in pixels.

profile.contentBoxes.depth1.itemSpacingO.title: Depth 1 - Apply Item Spacing on all items

profile.contentBoxes.depth2.background.i.title: image
profile.contentBoxes.depth2.background.i.description:
Set a background image or linear-gradient for the component.Note: Some special parsing may occur on this value.
- URL's beginning with a "~" character will be relative to the current theme directory. For example if the current file-based them is in /addons/themes/my-theme, ~/design/my-image.png would be equivalent to /addons/themes/my-theme/design/my-image.png
- Please pass _URLs_ for this variable. __Do not__ pass urls wrapped in "url()".

quickLinks.count.font.align.title: Alignment
quickLinks.count.font.align.description: Describes how text contents are horizontally aligned if the contents do not completely fill their container.
quickLinks.count.font.align.markdownDescription: Describes how text contents are horizontally aligned if the contents do not completely fill their container.

quickLinks.count.font.color.title: Color
quickLinks.count.font.color.description: Sets the color the components's text. Hexidecimal colors preferred (Either #RRGGBB or #RRGGBBAA)
quickLinks.count.font.color.markdownDescription: Sets the color the components's text. Hexidecimal colors preferred (Either #RRGGBB or #RRGGBBAA)

quickLinks.count.font.letterSpacing.title: Letter Spacing
quickLinks.count.font.letterSpacing.description: Sets the spacing behavior between text characters.
quickLinks.count.font.letterSpacing.markdownDescription: Sets the spacing behavior between text characters.

quickLinks.count.font.lineHeight.title: Line Height
quickLinks.count.font.lineHeight.description: Sets the distance between lines of text.
quickLinks.count.font.lineHeight.markdownDescription: Sets the distance between lines of text.

quickLinks.count.font.shadow.title: Text Shadow
quickLinks.count.font.shadow.description: Enables shadow effects to be applied to the text of the element. Allows any formats of [the CSS 'text-shadow' property.](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/text-shadow)
quickLinks.count.font.shadow.markdownDescription: Enables shadow effects to be applied to the text of the element. Allows any formats of [the CSS 'text-shadow' property.](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/text-shadow)

quickLinks.count.font.size.title: Size
quickLinks.count.font.size.description: Indicates the desired height of glyphs in the applied font. Numerical units will be applied as pixels, for example '12' will be interpreted as '12px'.
quickLinks.count.font.size.markdownDescription: Indicates the desired height of glyphs in the applied font. Numerical units will be applied as pixels, for example '12' will be interpreted as '12px'.

quickLinks.count.font.textDecoration.title: Text Decoration
quickLinks.count.font.textDecoration.description: Apply some decoration to the text.
quickLinks.count.font.textDecoration.markdownDescription: Apply some decoration to the text.

quickLinks.count.font.transform.title: Transform
quickLinks.count.font.transform.description: Specifies how to capitalize an element's text. It can be used to make text appear in all-uppercase or all-lowercase, or with each word capitalized.
quickLinks.count.font.transform.markdownDescription: Specifies how to capitalize an element's text. It can be used to make text appear in all-uppercase or all-lowercase, or with each word capitalized.

quickLinks.count.font.weight.title: Weight
quickLinks.count.font.weight.description: Specifies weight/boldness of glyphs in the applied font.
quickLinks.count.font.weight.markdownDescription: Specifies weight/boldness of glyphs in the applied font.

quickLinks.listItem.listSeparation.title: List Separation
quickLinks.listItem.listSeparation.description:
Describe how the list items should be separated from each other.
- none - The list items only have whitespace between them.
- border - The list items each have a full border and whitespace between the borders.
- separator - There is whitespace and a single line separating 2 items.
quickLinks.listItem.listSeparation.markdownDescription:
Describe how the list items should be separated from each other.
- none - The list items only have whitespace between them.
- border - The list items each have a full border and whitespace between the borders.
- separator - There is whitespace and a single line separating 2 items.

searchWidget.options.box.background.atta.title: attachment

searchWidget.options.box.background.atta.markdownDescription: Set the background attachment of the component. [MDN Reference](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/background-attachment)

searchWidget.options.box.background.colo.title: color
searchWidget.options.box.background.colo.description: Set the background color of the component.
searchWidget.options.box.background.colo.markdownDescription: Set the background color of the component.

searchWidget.options.box.background.imag.title: image
searchWidget.options.box.background.imag.description:
Set a background image or linear-gradient for the component.Note: Some special parsing may occur on this value.
- URL's beginning with a "~" character will be relative to the current theme directory. For example if the current file-based them is in /addons/themes/my-theme, ~/design/my-image.png would be equivalent to /addons/themes/my-theme/design/my-image.png
- Please pass _URLs_ for this variable. __Do not__ pass urls wrapped in "url()".

Set a background image or linear-gradient for the component.Note: Some special parsing may occur on this value.

- Please pass _URLs_ for this variable. __Do not__ pass urls wrapped in "url()".

searchWidget.options.box.background.posi.markdownDescription: Set the background position of the component. [MDN Reference](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/background-position)

searchWidget.options.box.background.size.markdownDescription: Set the background size of the component. [MDN Reference](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/background-size)

searchWidget.options.box.background.unse.title: Ignore Default Background
searchWidget.options.box.background.unse.description: Some components have a built-in background. In these scenarios setting this variable to true will remove the default background, even if other background properties are not specified.
searchWidget.options.box.background.unse.markdownDescription: Some components have a built-in background. In these scenarios setting this variable to true will remove the default background, even if other background properties are not specified.

searchWidget.options.box.borderType.title: Border Type
searchWidget.options.box.borderType.description:
Choose one of a few border types.

- none: Apply no styling on the box.
- border: Apply a standard border around the item. Automatically applies spacing as well. See the `global.border` variables to change this border.
- shadow: Apply a standard "widget" box shadow. Automatically applies spacing as well. See the `shadow.widget` variables to change this shadow.
- separator: Apply top and bottom separators to the item. Automatically applies vertical spacing.
searchWidget.options.box.borderType.markdownDescription:
Choose one of a few border types.

- none: Apply no styling on the box.
- border: Apply a standard border around the item. Automatically applies spacing as well. See the `global.border` variables to change this border.
- shadow: Apply a standard "widget" box shadow. Automatically applies spacing as well. See the `shadow.widget` variables to change this shadow.
- separator: Apply top and bottom separators to the item. Automatically applies vertical spacing.

tags.font.transform.markdownDescription: Specifies how to capitalize an element's text. It can be used to make text appear in all-uppercase or all-lowercase, or with each word capitalized.

tags.font.weight.title: Weight
tags.font.weight.description: Specifies weight/boldness of glyphs in the applied font.
tags.font.weight.markdownDescription: Specifies weight/boldness of glyphs in the applied font.

tags.fontState.align.title: Alignment
tags.fontState.align.description: Describes how text contents are horizontally aligned if the contents do not completely fill their container.
tags.fontState.align.markdownDescription: Describes how text contents are horizontally aligned if the contents do not completely fill their container.

tags.fontState.color.title: Color
tags.fontState.color.description: Sets the color the components's text. Hexidecimal colors preferred (Either #RRGGBB or #RRGGBBAA)
tags.fontState.color.markdownDescription: Sets the color the components's text. Hexidecimal colors preferred (Either #RRGGBB or #RRGGBBAA)

tags.fontState.letterSpacing.title: Letter Spacing
tags.fontState.letterSpacing.description: Sets the spacing behavior between text characters.
tags.fontState.letterSpacing.markdownDescription: Sets the spacing behavior between text characters.

tags.fontState.lineHeight.title: Line Height
tags.fontState.lineHeight.description: Sets the distance between lines of text.
tags.fontState.lineHeight.markdownDescription: Sets the distance between lines of text.

tags.fontState.shadow.title: Text Shadow
tags.fontState.shadow.description: Enables shadow effects to be applied to the text of the element. Allows any formats of [the CSS 'text-shadow' property.](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/text-shadow)
tags.fontState.shadow.markdownDescription: Enables shadow effects to be applied to the text of the element. Allows any formats of [the CSS 'text-shadow' property.](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/text-shadow)

tags.fontState.size.title: Size
tags.fontState.size.description: Indicates the desired height of glyphs in the applied font. Numerical units will be applied as pixels, for example '12' will be interpreted as '12px'.
tags.fontState.size.markdownDescription: Indicates the desired height of glyphs in the applied font. Numerical units will be applied as pixels, for example '12' will be interpreted as '12px'.

tags.tagCloud.box.background.attachment.title: attachment

tags.tagCloud.box.background.attachment.markdownDescription: Set the background attachment of the component. [MDN Reference](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/background-attachment)

tags.tagCloud.box.background.color.markdownDescription: Set the background color of the component.

tags.tagCloud.box.background.image.title: image
tags.tagCloud.box.background.image.description:
Set a background image or linear-gradient for the component.Note: Some special parsing may occur on this value.
- URL's beginning with a "~" character will be relative to the current theme directory. For example if the current file-based them is in /addons/themes/my-theme, ~/design/my-image.png would be equivalent to /addons/themes/my-theme/design/my-image.png
- Please pass _URLs_ for this variable. __Do not__ pass urls wrapped in "url()".
tags.tagCloud.box.background.image.markdownDescription:
Set a background image or linear-gradient for the component.Note: Some special parsing may occur on this value.
- URL's beginning with a "~" character will be relative to the current theme directory. For example if the current file-based them is in /addons/themes/my-theme, ~/design/my-image.png would be equivalent to /addons/themes/my-theme/design/my-image.png
- Please pass _URLs_ for this variable. __Do not__ pass urls wrapped in "url()".

tags.tagCloud.box.background.unsetBackgr.title: Ignore Default Background
tags.tagCloud.box.background.unsetBackgr.description: Some components have a built-in background. In these scenarios setting this variable to true will remove the default background, even if other background properties are not specified.
tags.tagCloud.box.background.unsetBackgr.markdownDescription: Some components have a built-in background. In these scenarios setting this variable to true will remove the default background, even if other background properties are not specified.

tags.tagCloud.box.borderType.title: Border Type
tags.tagCloud.box.borderType.description:
Choose one of a few border types.

- none: Apply no styling on the box.
- border: Apply a standard border around the item. Automatically applies spacing as well. See the `global.border` variables to change this border.
- shadow: Apply a standard "widget" box shadow. Automatically applies spacing as well. See the `shadow.widget` variables to change this shadow.
- separator: Apply top and bottom separators to the item. Automatically applies vertical spacing.
tags.tagCloud.box.borderType.markdownDescription:
Choose one of a few border types.

- none: Apply no styling on the box.
- border: Apply a standard border around the item. Automatically applies spacing as well. See the `global.border` variables to change this border.
- shadow: Apply a standard "widget" box shadow. Automatically applies spacing as well. See the `shadow.widget` variables to change this shadow.
- separator: Apply top and bottom separators to the item. Automatically applies vertical spacing.

tags.tagCloud.box.itemSpacing.title: tagCloud - box - Item Spacing

tags.tagCloud.box.itemSpacing.markdownDescription: For certain border types, there is space between in items. This is that space in pixels.

titleBar.border.color.markdownDescription: Set the color of the border.

titleBar.colors.bg.title: Background Color
titleBar.colors.bg.description:
Background color for the titlebar.
It's recommended that this color have sufficient color with the foreground color.
titleBar.colors.bg.markdownDescription:
Background color for the titlebar.
It's recommended that this color have sufficient color with the foreground color.

titleBar.colors.bgImage.title: Background Image
titleBar.colors.bgImage.description:
Apply a background image over the Title Bar.
This image will will fill the full background of the Title Bar and will not be stretched.
It's recommended to use a very wide patterned image,
of which the middle portion make sense on it's own (for mobile devices.)
This should be a full URL to an image.
titleBar.colors.bgImage.markdownDescription:
Apply a background image over the Title Bar.
This image will will fill the full background of the Title Bar and will not be stretched.
It's recommended to use a very wide patterned image,
of which the middle portion make sense on it's own (for mobile devices.)
This should be a full URL to an image.

titleBar.colors.fg.title: Foreground/Text Color
titleBar.colors.fg.description:
Foreground color for the titlebar.
It's recommended that this color have sufficient color with the background color.
titleBar.colors.fg.markdownDescription:
Foreground color for the titlebar.
It's recommended that this color have sufficient color with the background color.

titleBar.colors.state.bg.title: Foreground Color (State)
titleBar.colors.state.bg.description:
The foreground hover/state color for various buttons in the Title Bar.
It is recommended that this color have strong contrast with the background color.
By default this color is generated based on the regular color.
titleBar.colors.state.bg.markdownDescription:
The foreground hover/state color for various buttons in the Title Bar.
It is recommended that this color have strong contrast with the background color.
By default this color is generated based on the regular color.

titleBar.fullBleed.bgColor.title: Background Color
titleBar.fullBleed.bgColor.description:
The background color of the full bleed titlebar when it is transparent/semi-transparent.
This defaults to the normal titleBar.colors.bg color, but can be a different color.
For example, you may want to use a semi-transparent white/black while overlaying the banner,
but want the titlebar to transition a brand color when on it's own or scrolled down the page.
titleBar.fullBleed.bgColor.markdownDescription:
The background color of the full bleed titlebar when it is transparent/semi-transparent.
This defaults to the normal titleBar.colors.bg color, but can be a different color.
For example, you may want to use a semi-transparent white/black while overlaying the banner,
but want the titlebar to transition a brand color when on it's own or scrolled down the page.

titleBar.fullBleed.enabled.title: Enabled
titleBar.fullBleed.enabled.description:
Enable a "full bleed" title bar.
This caused to titlebar to be transparent or semi-transparent and site *on top* of the banner.
titleBar.fullBleed.enabled.markdownDescription:
Enable a "full bleed" title bar.
This caused to titlebar to be transparent or semi-transparent and site *on top* of the banner.

titleBar.fullBleed.endingOpacity.title: Ending Opacity
titleBar.fullBleed.endingOpacity.description:
An opacity value between 0 and 1 that determins how transparent the full bleed titlebar is
as the banner is scrolled out of view.
The banner *always* becomes completely solid after the transition,
so this value only affects the transition between states.
This value cannot be less than the `titleBar.fullBleed.startingOpacity` value.
0 - Fully transparent.
0.3 - Semi transparent.
1 - Completely solid
titleBar.fullBleed.endingOpacity.markdownDescription:
An opacity value between 0 and 1 that determins how transparent the full bleed titlebar is
as the banner is scrolled out of view.
The banner *always* becomes completely solid after the transition,
so this value only affects the transition between states.
This value cannot be less than the `titleBar.fullBleed.startingOpacity` value.
0 - Fully transparent.
0.3 - Semi transparent.
1 - Completely solid

titleBar.fullBleed.startingOpacity.title: Starting Opacity
titleBar.fullBleed.startingOpacity.description:
An opacity value between 0 and 1 that determins how transparent the full bleed titlebar is
when sitting on top of the banner.
0 - Fully transparent.
0.3 - Semi transparent.
1 - Completely solid
titleBar.fullBleed.startingOpacity.markdownDescription:
An opacity value between 0 and 1 that determins how transparent the full bleed titlebar is
when sitting on top of the banner.
0 - Fully transparent.
0.3 - Semi transparent.
1 - Completely solid

titleBar.logo.doubleLogoStrategy.title: Double Logo Strategy
titleBar.logo.doubleLogoStrategy.description:
A strategy for dealing with multiple logos when using a custom theme header with the titlebar.
- visible (default) - Always show the logo in the titlebar.
- hidden - Hide the logo in the titlebar.
- fade-in - Fade the logo in after the custom theme header scrolls of the page.
titleBar.logo.doubleLogoStrategy.markdownDescription:
A strategy for dealing with multiple logos when using a custom theme header with the titlebar.
- visible (default) - Always show the logo in the titlebar.
- hidden - Hide the logo in the titlebar.
- fade-in - Fade the logo in after the custom theme header scrolls of the page.

titleBar.overlay.background.title: Background Overlay

An background to overlay on top of a background image if one is specified.
Accepts any value that works for a CSS "background" property.

titleBar.swoop.amount.title: Amount
titleBar.swoop.amount.description:
Create a curved bottom border on the Title Bar.
Larger numbers give a bigger "swoop". Please note that this adds some additional space into the bottom of the titlebar.
A value of 10 gives a very subtle swoop that should not require much adjustment elsewhere.
A value of 50 gives a very pronounced swoop and will require adjustments in padding to compensate.
The follow variables should be used together to fine your desired swoop.
titleBar.swoop.amount.markdownDescription:
Create a curved bottom border on the Title Bar.
Larger numbers give a bigger "swoop". Please note that this adds some additional space into the bottom of the titlebar.
A value of 10 gives a very subtle swoop that should not require much adjustment elsewhere.
A value of 50 gives a very pronounced swoop and will require adjustments in padding to compensate.
The follow variables should be used together to fine your desired swoop.

titleBar.swoop.swoopOffset.title: Offset
titleBar.swoop.swoopOffset.description:
This parameter determines how much the swoop extends "outside" of the TitleBar
Large offsets may require adjustments in padding.
The follow variables should be used together to fine your desired swoop.
titleBar.swoop.swoopOffset.markdownDescription:

titleBarMegaMenu.wrapper.background.imag.description:
Set a background image or linear-gradient for the component.Note: Some special parsing may occur on this value.
- URL's beginning with a "~" character will be relative to the current theme directory. For example if the current file-based them is in /addons/themes/my-theme, ~/design/my-image.png would be equivalent to /addons/themes/my-theme/design/my-image.png
- Please pass _URLs_ for this variable. __Do not__ pass urls wrapped in "url()".

userSpotlight.options.box.background.ima.title: image
userSpotlight.options.box.background.ima.description:
Set a background image or linear-gradient for the component.Note: Some special parsing may occur on this value.
- URL's beginning with a "~" character will be relative to the current theme directory. For example if the current file-based them is in /addons/themes/my-theme, ~/design/my-image.png would be equivalent to /addons/themes/my-theme/design/my-image.png
- Please pass _URLs_ for this variable. __Do not__ pass urls wrapped in "url()".
userSpotlight.options.box.background.ima.markdownDescription:
Set a background image or linear-gradient for the component.Note: Some special parsing may occur on this value.
- URL's beginning with a "~" character will be relative to the current theme directory. For example if the current file-based them is in /addons/themes/my-theme, ~/design/my-image.png would be equivalent to /addons/themes/my-theme/design/my-image.png
- Please pass _URLs_ for this variable. __Do not__ pass urls wrapped in "url()".

userSpotlight.options.box.background.uns.title: Ignore Default Background
userSpotlight.options.box.background.uns.description: Some components have a built-in background. In these scenarios setting this variable to true will remove the default background, even if other background properties are not specified.
userSpotlight.options.box.background.uns.markdownDescription: Some components have a built-in background. In these scenarios setting this variable to true will remove the default background, even if other background properties are not specified.

userSpotlight.options.box.borderType.title: Border Type
userSpotlight.options.box.borderType.description:
Choose one of a few border types.

- none: Apply no styling on the box.
- border: Apply a standard border around the item. Automatically applies spacing as well. See the `global.border` variables to change this border.
- shadow: Apply a standard "widget" box shadow. Automatically applies spacing as well. See the `shadow.widget` variables to change this shadow.
- separator: Apply top and bottom separators to the item. Automatically applies vertical spacing.
userSpotlight.options.box.borderType.markdownDescription:
Choose one of a few border types.

- none: Apply no styling on the box.
- border: Apply a standard border around the item. Automatically applies spacing as well. See the `global.border` variables to change this border.
- shadow: Apply a standard "widget" box shadow. Automatically applies spacing as well. See the `shadow.widget` variables to change this shadow.
- separator: Apply top and bottom separators to the item. Automatically applies vertical spacing.

userSpotlight.title.font.align.title: Alignment
userSpotlight.title.font.align.description: Describes how text contents are horizontally aligned if the contents do not completely fill their container.

userSpotlight.title.font.color.title: Color
userSpotlight.title.font.color.description: Sets the color the components's text. Hexidecimal colors preferred (Either #RRGGBB or #RRGGBBAA)

userSpotlight.title.font.lineHeight.title: Line Height
userSpotlight.title.font.lineHeight.description: Sets the distance between lines of text.

userSpotlight.title.font.shadow.title: Text Shadow
userSpotlight.title.font.shadow.description: Enables shadow effects to be applied to the text of the element. Allows any formats of [the CSS 'text-shadow' property.](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/text-shadow)
